intro: Paratropia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed paratropia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its rounded, palmate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
